resources.string: What do you want to know\?
Daily nutrient needs threshold saved successfully
Maaf sepertinya ada masalah, silahkan coba lagi nanti..
My food and drink plan today

Chronic kidney failure is a sudden decline in kidney function, generally occurring over several hours to several days, leading to disturbances in the body\'s fluid, electrolyte, and acid-base balance.
The normal function of the kidneys is to filter the body\'s metabolic waste. If these substances are not excreted, they will accumulate and become toxic, posing a danger to health.
The causes of chronic kidney failure vary, but most are due to long-term conditions such as hypertension and diabetes. Kidney failure can also be caused by an unhealthy lifestyle, including:

string-array.name: penyebab_gagal_ginjal_bullet_points
string-array.item: Consuming large amounts of food high in sugar, salt, and saturated fats.
Insufficient fluid intake leading to dehydration.
Uncontrolled hypertension (high blood pressure) and diabetes (high blood sugar).

resources.string: In the early stages, kidney failure symptoms are not very noticeable. Symptoms usually appear at stages 4–5, including:

string-array.name: tanda_gejala_bullet_points
string-array.item: Easily fatigued
Dry and itchy skin
Nausea and vomiting
Decrease or increase in urination frequency
Frequent urination at night
Shortness of breath
Swelling in both legs
Weight loss

string-array.name: pemeriksaan_diagnosa_bullet_points
string-array.item: Complete blood test: to detect waste levels in the blood
Urine test: In this test, the doctor checks the levels of albumin and creatinine in the urine, and the protein content in the urine

resources.string: Prevention can be done in several ways, such as:

string-array.name: pencegahan_bullet_points
string-array.item: Consuming a complete and balanced nutritious diet
Limit foods high in salt, saturated fats, and uric acid
Drink enough water, at least 8 glasses a day
Maintain an ideal body weight
Do not smoke
Avoid taking painkillers without first consulting a doctor
Avoid packaged drinks containing a lot of artificial sweeteners
Reduce instant foods that contain preservatives, flavorings, and colorings
Keep blood pressure normal

resources.string: Treatment aims to reduce symptoms, not to restore kidney function. Some treatments given for kidney failure therapy include:

string-array.name: pengobatan_bullet_points
string-array.item: Medications to reduce symptoms, such as drugs for hypertension, anemia, calcium supplements, and vitamin D.
Restriction of protein and fluid intake.
Renal replacement therapy is divided into two types:
Dialysis: the process of filtering waste and fluids from the body.
Hemodialysis (blood washing): a dialysis procedure using a machine.
Continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis (CAPD): a blood washing method done through the abdomen.
Kidney transplant: the patient\'s kidney is replaced with a healthy kidney from a donor (organ transplant).

resources.string: Chronic kidney failure can trigger the following conditions:

string-array.name: kondisi_lanjut_bullet_points
string-array.item: Electrolyte disorders such as phosphorus buildup and hyperkalemia (an increase in potassium levels in the blood)
Imbalances in the body\'s acid-base balance, such as acidosis
Heart and blood vessel diseases
Excess fluid buildup in body cavities, such as pulmonary edema or ascites
Anemia, because the kidneys also function to form red blood cells
Central nervous system damage, which can cause seizures

resources.string: Hemodialysis is an external blood washing therapy. Hemodialysis is a treatment to filter waste and water from the blood.
To help the kidneys perform their function in the body. If kidney failure patients do not undergo a transplant, this procedure needs to be done regularly.

string-array.name: kapan_melakukan_hemodialisa_bullet_points
string-array.item: Shortness of breath
Fatigue
Muscle cramps
Nausea or vomiting

string-array.name: bagaimana_melakukan_hemodialisa_bullet_points
string-array.item: Medical personnel will insert a needle into the patient\'s blood vessel
Dirty blood will be filtered in the dialysis machine. After the filtering process is complete
Clean blood will be circulated back into the patient\'s body

string-array.name: efek_samping_hemodialisa_bullet_points
string-array.item: Muscle cramps
Itchy skin
Feeling of fullness in the abdomen
Weight gain

string-array.name: dampak_telat_cuci_darah_bullet_points
string-array.item: Swelling in parts of the body such as hands and feet
Shortness of breath
Decreased kidney function and may eventually stop altogether
Accumulation of toxins in the blood as more waste and toxins build up in the body

resources.string: Hemodialysis therapy or blood washing can only be done in hospitals that have hemodialysis facilities or specialized dialysis clinics.
Why Must My Fluid and Drink Intake Be Regulated?

Excess fluid can cause heart problems and fluid buildup in the body, leading to excessive weight gain between dialysis sessions. The recommended weight gain between hemodialysis sessions is less than three kilograms.

string-array.name: berapa_kebutuhan_cairan_bullet_points
string-array.item: If urine is still present, fluid intake should equal the amount of urine in 24 hours plus 500 to 750cc.
If there is no urine, the maximum amount of fluid is 14 small glasses or 800cc, including water from food and drinks.

string-array.name: tips_mengurangi_cairan_bullet_points
string-array.item: Food should be prepared without broth.
Reduce salt intake or salty foods to decrease thirst.
Drink water using a bottle instead of a glass.
Consume sour candies or ice cubes.
Maintain oral hygiene.

string-array.name: tips_mengontrol_haus_bullet_points
string-array.item: Avoid spicy and salty foods, as well as foods high in sodium or salt.
Avoid greasy or fried foods.
Drink water slowly using a small glass, and try to stay in a cool place.
Schedule your water intake over 24 hours, divided into three sessions with a total of 500cc in 24 hours.

string-array.name: pembagian_waktu_minum_bullet_points
string-array.item: From 6 AM to 12 PM, 240cc.
From 12 PM to 6 PM, 150cc.
From 6 PM to 6 AM the next day, 110cc, for a total fluid intake of 500cc in 24 hours.

string-array.name: perawatan_akses_vaskuler_bullet_points
string-array.item: Keep the dressing dry.
If you are going to bathe, cover the catheter dressing with plastic first.
If the dressing gets wet, change it immediately.
Always use clean clothes and towels.
Be careful when changing clothes to avoid snagging the catheter.
Wash hands frequently and avoid touching the catheter.
Do not sleep on the side where the catheter is located.
Consult a doctor if you notice signs of infection such as redness, swelling, or pain in the access area.
If blood leaks from the catheter, go to the emergency room for further treatment.
Use of the CDL is recommended for no more than 3 months; schedule the creation of a cimino before that period ends.

string-array.name: perawatan_cimino_bullet_points
string-array.item: Keep the access area clean at all times.
Wash the access area with soap and warm water, and always wash your hands before and after touching the cimino.
Check for vibrations and a characteristic buzzing sound in your access. Changes in the buzzing sound may indicate a blockage or disruption in blood flow.
Do not allow blood pressure checks, intravenous insertions, or blood draws on the arm with the cimino access.
Avoid lifting heavy objects, wearing watches, jewelry, or tight clothing on the arm with the cimino access.
Ensure the cimino access does not get bumped or cut.
Consult a doctor if there are any issues with the cimino.

resources.string: Why must the diet/food of patients be regulated?
The kidneys can no longer eliminate waste products from food because they are no longer functioning optimally.
What is the purpose of regulating the diet/food of patients?
Uncontrolled intake of nutrients and fluids can lead to malnutrition, and in severe cases, death.
Purpose of diet/food for hemodialysis patients:

string-array.name: tujuan_diet_hemodialisa_bullet_points
string-array.item: To meet individual nutrient needs and ensure optimal nutritional status.
Maintain fluid and electrolyte balance.
Prevent excessive buildup of metabolic waste from protein.
Prevent nutrient deficiencies by ensuring adequate nutrient intake.

string-array.name: syarat_diet_hemodialisa_bullet_points
string-array.item: Calories must be sufficient to prevent protein breakdown for energy.
Protein intake should be adequate to meet the body\'s needs and replace protein lost during each hemodialysis session.
Limit potassium-rich foods, especially if urine output is less than 400ml or if blood potassium levels exceed 5.5 mg/liter.
Limit salt and sodium sources if there is fluid retention and high blood pressure.
Fluid intake should match the amount of urine produced in a day plus 500ml of water.
Vitamins and minerals should be supplemented in medication form.

string-array.name: bahan_makanan_dibatasi_bullet_points
string-array.item: Protein sources: legumes and their products, such as tofu, tempeh, soybeans, mung beans, and black-eyed peas.
Vitamin and mineral sources: vegetables and fruits high in potassium.
Preserved foods: corned beef, sardines.
Salt intake.

resources.string: Tips for appropriate salt use for hemodialysis patients:

string-array.name: tips_penggunaan_garam_bullet_points
string-array.item: Use a small amount of salt and add it at the end of cooking.
Do not add seasoning or table salt or extra salt to food.
Avoid salt-preserved foods, salty snacks, canned foods, and fast food.

string-array.name: cara_mengatur_diet_bullet_points
string-array.item: Eat regularly, in small portions but frequently, around 6 times a day.
Serve food attractively to enhance appetite.
Choose animal protein sources according to the specified amount.
Plant-based proteins have lower quality compared to animal proteins (limited).
High-calorie foods: honey, candy, syrup.
Limit potassium-rich foods, such as vegetables, fruits, and tubers.
Avoid foods high in potassium, such as legumes, spinach, bananas, coconut water, avocados, durians, jackfruits, cauliflower.
If urine output is lower than normal, limit fluid intake from food and drinks.

resources.string: How to prepare and process food:

string-array.name: cara_mempersiapkan_makanan_bullet_points
string-array.item: Reduce potassium content in food ingredients.
Cut food into small pieces.
Soak in warm water for at least 2 hours.
Discard the soaking water.
Rinse the food under running water.
All vegetables should be cooked; avoid eating raw vegetables (salads).
If salt is restricted, use more spices such as sugar, acid, and other seasonings.
To limit fluid, dishes should not be broth-based, such as stir-fried, grilled, steamed, baked, or fried foods.

resources.string: Nutrition and Diet Management\nin Hemodialysis Patients
